intro: Melicytus novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand melicytus, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for native birds. It typically grows in coastal and lowland forests, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
